artist: John Gordon Rideout; Harold L. Van Doren; Wagner Ware Manufacturing Co.
description: squat, round body with attached handle
text: The Wagner Manufacturing Company made traditional cast-iron cookware in the 19th century and began producing aluminum ware at the turn of the century.  The company introduced Magnalite, a patented magnesium-aluminum alloy, in the1930s.  This jointly-designed model introduced a unique feature to tea kettles: it is lidless.  Liquids are poured in and out of the spout.
title: Tea kettle
